availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Frances Blandford. Father of F.W. Blandford, Marietta Blandford, James W. Blandford, M.E. Blandford, Pernetha Blandford. Blacksmith in Taylor County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1850. Owned one enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 195A.

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 78B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860),Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Division 1, p. 11.
